oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Breeding soundness examination of a Longhorn bull pelleted with lead shot
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Elmore, Ronnie G.
Brinsko, Steven P.
Morris, David L.
Warner, Gary D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bulls
Case reports
Castration
cattle diseases
Lameness
Lead
Male infertility
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This case is presented because it 1) demonstrates the importance of being thorough while conducting a lameness and/or breeding soundness examination of a bull, 2) is an example of one bull that in spite of an extemely poor prognosis for fertility has since sired more than twenty-five calves, and 3) is an example of a bull that responded favorably to unconventional and radical treatment. Although not used routinely, selected radiographic and ultrasonographic examination of the scrotal contents can aid in the diagnosis of some infertile bulls.
